messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: INCIDENT REPORT: #J-5522-GH DATE: 11/20/24  During the evening of November 20, the Central Bank on Elm Street experienced an attempted robbery. The bank's alarm system was triggered immediately, notifying local law enforcement agencies. The assailants, upon realizing the swift response time, fled the scene without any loot.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  EARLY RESPONDENTS: Patrol Officer Y. Z. A. Peters and Patrol Officer B. C. D. Foster were the first to arrive, establishing a perimeter and ensuring the safety of bank staff and patrons. TACTICAL RESPONSE: Lieutenant E. F. G. Wells led a SWAT team to clear the bank, ensuring no remaining threats inside. INVESTIGATIVE TEAM: Detectives H. I. J. Stone and K. L. M. Williams were tasked with gathering evidence from the crime scene and interviewing witnesses. FORENSIC ANALYSIS: Criminalist N. O. P. Gomez and Technician Q. R. S. Nunez started processing evidence, including fingerprints and CCTV footage. Dr. T. U. V. King was called to analyze potential biological samples left behind. Within hours, Officers Peters and Foster obtained descriptions of the suspects and their getaway vehicle. Lt. Wells and his team confirmed the bank's safety. Detectives Stone and Williams identified the suspects as members of the notorious Hawthorn Gang. Gomez and Nunez uncovered fingerprints leading to two known gang members, and Dr. King identified traces of a specific fabric dye linked to a local underground market.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Y. Z. A. Peters  
Officer Context: Officer Peters was among the first to respond and helped establish a perimeter.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer B. C. D. Foster  
Officer Context: Officer Foster ensured the safety of bank staff and patrons upon arrival.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Lieutenant E. F. G. Wells  
Officer Context: Lt. Wells led a SWAT team to clear the bank.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Detective H. I. J. Stone  
Officer Context: Detective Stone gathered evidence and identified the suspects as Hawthorn Gang members.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. M. Williams  
Officer Context: Detective Williams took witness statements and corroborated gang involvement.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Criminalist N. O. P. Gomez  
Officer Context: Criminalist Gomez processed fingerprints linking to known gang members.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Technician Q. R. S. Nunez  
Officer Context: Technician Nunez analyzed CCTV footage from the scene.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Dr. T. U. V. King  
Officer Context: Dr. King found and analyzed biological samples and a specific fabric dye.  
Officer Role: Forensic Scientist
